title: Tenerife Delivers Dazzling Finale as Curtain Comes Down on IGTM 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Tenerife Delivers Dazzling Finale as Curtain Comes Down on IGTM 2015 Published on : Thursday, October 15, 2015
Tenerife saved its best until last as the curtain came down on the 2015 International Golf Travel Market (IGTM), the world’s premier event for the golf tourism industry, in glittering fashion at Siam Park.
Europe’s most spectacular water theme park provided a fitting venue for the event’s gala dinner and awards ceremony, bringing to a close the most successful week in the island’s blossoming golf history.
After being given a tour of the amazing 185,000m2 park in Costa Adeje and enjoying a drinks reception, the 1,000-plus guests were then treated to a gala dinner on the beach by Siam Park’s wave pool, which produces artificial waves up to three metres high – the biggest in the world.
And, with dinner having been served and all the awards having been handed out by the International Association of Golf Tour Operators (IAGTO), Tenerife Golf – the Tenerife Tourism Corporation’s golfing arm – brought the event to a climax with a spectacular fireworks display before delegates headed into town to celebrate a successful four days at the Papagayo Beach Club.
“We are so proud to have had the opportunity to bring the global golf tourism industry together over the last week,” said Tenerife president Carlos Alonso.
“The initial feedback that we have received from the delegates has been outstanding and has fully vindicated Tenerife’s desire to host the event.
“We are confident that golf visitor numbers to our island will increase, not just from our traditional inbound markets but also from new emerging destinations. The event has been an unqualified success for Tenerife.”
The 18th edition of IGTM, which was sponsored by Tenerife Tourism Corporation, Turespaña and the Canary Island Government and organised by Reed Exhibitions, took place at the Magma Conference Centre from October 5-8, and was the first time that Tenerife had been handed the honour of hosting the event.
This year’s event, one of the biggest in its history, brought together a record number of buyers, 500 exhibitors from 65 countries and more than 50 registered media.
Featuring key figures from the global golf travel industry from countries as far afield as Malaysia, Australia, China, Russia and Japan, an estimated 11,300 pre-scheduled meetings took place during the course of the four days.
The largest of the Canary Islands and blessed with average annual temperatures of 23⁰, Tenerife is an established destination for European golfers both in the winter and summer thanks to its perfect all-year round climate, as well as being the ideal place for people of all ages to enjoy a range of sports and outdoor activities.
Featuring nine different and varied layouts, the island offers 70km of beaches and a wide range of cultural highlights and activities both on and off the water, making it the ideal location for a golf break. Last year alone, its courses took an impressive combined total of 300,000 green fees.
Source:- IAGTO
